Oyster Shack We serve only the finest oysters from Appalachicola. If it happens that you don’t enjoy oysters, we also have burgers, grouper and chicken to satisfy your appetite. Don’t forget, we have beer, wine and liquor to accompany your meal. We have entertainment throughout the week for everybody, including live music, open mic, karaoke, and trivia! We serve only the finest oysters from Appalachicola. If it happens that you don’t enjoy oysters, we also have burgers, grouper and chicken to satisfy your appetite. Don’t forget, we have beer, wine and liquor to accompany your meal. We have entertainment throughout the week for everybody, including live music, open mic, karaoke, and trivia! Wheelchair Access OUR PARTNERS COCA's programs are sponsored in part by the City of Tallahassee, Leon County, the State of Florida, Department of State, Division of Cultural Affairs, Community Foundation of North Florida, Knight Foundation, National Endowment for the Arts, and the Tallahassee Community Redevelopment Agency. COCA, the Council on Culture & Arts, is a non-profit organization that serves as the facilitator and voice for the arts and cultural industry in Florida's capital area. COCA provides information and promotes the arts and culture to both citizens and visitors. ABOUT US DIRECTORIES CLASSIFIEDS PARTNERS CONTACT US 114 S DUVAL STREET TALLAHASSEE, FL 32301 LOCAL NUMBER: (850) 224-2500 EMAIL: info@tallahasseearts.org © Copyright 2025 - Council on Culture & Arts | Contact Us | Site Map | Privacy Policy Powered by ARTSOPOLIS The COCA office currently has adjusted office hours to 1 PM – 5 PM to accommodate pickup for Winterfest. These hours will be adjusted from Tuesday, February 11, through Friday, February 28 . Regular office hours will return on Monday, March 3. For questions, feel free to contact staff via phone or email. In addition, access to Railroad Avenue between Gaines Street & FAMU Way is down to one lane heading south. For access to the COCA office, please take Gaines Street as currently, the COCA office is not accessible off of FAMU Way.
